items.description:
Happy Friday,

With all the stress happening in the US with elections, you are probably looking forward to relaxing with some friendly Xamarin news.

Have a great weekend everyone!

❤

Kym
items.description_markdown:

items.title: The Ultimate Guide To Mobile In-App Purchases Optimization
items.description:
Mobile app monetization is one of the most important factors to consider when developing a mobile app. After all, every developer’s end-goal is to generate revenue out of their app, not only to cover its costs but to make a profit as well.

The Ultimate Guide To Mobile In-App Purchases Optimization by Hady ElHady
items.description_markdown:
Mobile app monetization is one of the most important factors to consider when developing a mobile app. After all, every developer’s end-goal is to generate revenue out of their app, not only to cover its costs but to make a profit as well.

[**The Ultimate Guide To Mobile In-App Purchases Optimization**](https://instabug.com/blog/mobile-in-app-purchases/) by [Hady ElHady](https://twitter.com/HadyElHady93)

embedded_links.title: **The Ultimate Guide To Mobile In-App Purchases Optimization**

items.title: New WiFi API in Android 11
items.description:
Android 11 allows you to use Intents to add Wifi information to a device. Check out how in this post.

New WiFi API in Android 11 by Tomasz Cielecki
items.description_markdown:
Android 11 allows you to use Intents to add Wifi information to a device. Check out how in this post.


[**New WiFi API in Android 11**](https://blog.ostebaronen.dk/2020/11/android-11-wifi.html) by [Tomasz Cielecki](https://twitter.com/cheesebaron)

items.title: Xamarin Android binding libraries
items.description:
Creating a Xamarin Android binding library is not an easy task. John Thiriet, by his own admissions, has done quite a lot of those on private and public SDKs. This series explores how he does it.

Creating a Xamarin Android binding library - Preparation by John Thiriet
items.description_markdown:
Creating a Xamarin Android binding library is not an easy task. John Thiriet, by his own admissions, has done quite a lot of those on private and public SDKs. This series explores how he does it.

[**Creating a Xamarin Android binding library - Preparation**](https://johnthiriet.com/xamarin-android-binding-library-preparation/) by [John Thiriet](https://twitter.com/johnthiriet)

embedded_links.title: **Creating a Xamarin Android binding library - Preparation**

items.title: Body tracking with ARKit
items.description:
In this example we will look at how ARKit can detect a body in the scene and track its major joints as it moves around. We will also see how we can superimpose nodes onto the locations of those detected joints in 3D space.

Body tracking by Lee Englestone
items.description_markdown:
In this example we will look at how ARKit can detect a body in the scene and track its major joints as it moves around. We will also see how we can superimpose nodes onto the locations of those detected joints in 3D space.

[**Body tracking**](https://www.xamarinarkit.com/lesson/body-tracking/) by [Lee Englestone](https://twitter.com/leeenglestone)

items.description:

embedded_links.title: **Best Xamarin Forms App Examples on the Market**

items.title: Busy Overlay in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
During long-running blocking operations such as login, the application UI should be disabled and the user should get visual feedback that some processing is in progress. Although there is an ActivityIndicator in Xamarin.Forms, there's no easy built-in way to create an overlay.

Busy Overlay in Xamarin.Forms by Damir Arh
items.description_markdown:
During long-running blocking operations such as login, the application UI should be disabled and the user should get visual feedback that some processing is in progress. Although there is an ActivityIndicator in Xamarin.Forms, there's no easy built-in way to create an overlay.

[**Busy Overlay in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.damirscorner.com/blog/posts/20201106-BusyOverlayInXamarinForms.html) by [Damir Arh](https://twitter.com/DamirArh/)

items.description:

items.title: App Settings vs User Preferences vs Secrets.
items.description:
There are a multitude of ways to store configuration data in your Apps. What are the options? How are they different? How do you use them in Xamarin.Forms? So many questions, maybe this blog post will help you out.

Xamarin Forms: App Settings vs User Preferences vs Secrets. by Angel Garcia
items.description_markdown:
There are a multitude of ways to store configuration data in your Apps.  What are the options? How are they different? How do you use them in Xamarin.Forms? So many questions, maybe this blog post will help you out.

[**Xamarin Forms: App Settings vs User Preferences vs Secrets.**](http://talkwithangel.com/xamarin-forms-app-settings-vs-user-preferences-vs-secrets/) by [Angel Garcia](https://twitter.com/_AngelGarcia13)

embedded_links.title: **Xamarin Forms: App Settings vs User Preferences vs Secrets.**

items.title: .NET Conf - mark your calendars!
items.description:
Save the date for .NET Conf, live streaming to a device near you November 10-12 on www.dotnetconf.net. .NET Conf is a free, three-day, virtual developer event co-organized by the .NET community and Microsoft. This year .NET 5.0 will launch at .NET Conf 2020.

.NET Blog by Beth Massi
items.description_markdown:
Save the date for .NET Conf, live streaming to a device near you November 10-12 on www.dotnetconf.net. .NET Conf is a free, three-day, virtual developer event co-organized by the .NET community and Microsoft. This year .NET 5.0 will launch at .NET Conf 2020.

[**.NET Blog**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/net-5-0-launches-at-net-conf-november-10-12/) by [Beth Massi](https://twitter.com/bethmassi)

items.title: Protecting Sensitive Data in the Background in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
This blog post covers how to stop your application having a windows snapshot when moving between apps. An important aspect for secure applications.

Protecting Sensitive Data in the Background in Xamarin.Forms by Vicente Guzman
items.description_markdown:
This blog post covers how to stop your application having a windows snapshot when moving between apps. An important aspect for secure applications.

[**Protecting Sensitive Data in the Background in Xamarin.Forms**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/protecting-sensitive-data-in-the-background-in-xamarin-forms.aspx) by [Vicente Guzman](https://twitter.com/LucioMSP)

embedded_links.title: **Protecting Sensitive Data in the Background in Xamarin.Forms**

items.title: Xamarin Community Standup - Blazor + Xamarin
items.description:
Join the Xamarin Team as they discuss the latest and greatest for Xamarin. This week we sit down with Eilon Lipton to discuss the latest in the Mobile Blazor Bindings.

Xamarin Community Standup - Blazor + Xamarin == WHOA! with Eilon Lipton by dotNet Youtube Channel

items.title: Null Pointers 25: Xamarin.Forms 5
items.description:
Xamarin.Forms 5 is announced to be the last major version of Forms in its current form. From here on out, it will evolve into the .NET framework and continue to bring us joy that way. But, what is actually in the Forms 5 package? What can we look forward to? Find out in this episode!

25: Xamarin.Forms 5 by Null Pointers
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin.Forms 5 is announced to be the last major version of Forms in its current form. From here on out, it will evolve into the .NET framework and continue to bring us joy that way. But, what is actually in the Forms 5 package? What can we look forward to? Find out in this episode!

[**25: Xamarin.Forms 5**](https://nullpointers.io/25/) by [Null Pointers](https://twitter.com/nullpointersio)
